node.title: SA Premier apologises after surge in applications to enter SA crash website
node.alt: Logos for the EntryCheck SA and HealthCheck SA apps
node.description: SA's website for entry assessment is inundated with more than 25,000 applications ahead of the state borders opening at 12:01am on Tuesday.
node.content:
["As South Australia prepares to open its border on Tuesday,\u00a0the state government's website for entry assessment\u00a0has been inundated with more than 25,000 applications.\u00a0", "The EntryCheck SA website was scheduled to go live at 5pm last Friday but was not available until around 6pm.\u00a0", "The portal crashed under the high volume of traffic on Monday\u00a0morning, telling users to \"please try again later\".\u00a0", "South Australia\u00a0Premier Steven Marshall said the site had been inundated with more than 25,000 applications since Friday evening.\u00a0", "\"Apologies for that portal being down today but it is up and running now,\" he said.\u00a0", "\"It's processed 25,000 people looking to come into South Australia.\"", "", "
The EntryCheck SA website crumbled under the pressure when it was inundated with applications.\u00a0(ABC News)
", "Mr Marshall said the website had been developed in \"record time\".\u00a0", "\"It is a complex system and it needs to be because there are different arrangements for people coming in from different destinations based on their status,\" he said.\u00a0", "\"The development of software like this would usually be a six\u00a0or a\u00a012-month arrangement, especially one that was going to be under such a heavy use.\"\u00a0", "Everyone who wants to enter SA once the border is open needs to use the EntryCheck SA website to submit an application.\u00a0", "The website\u00a0outlines the restrictions that apply to each applicant based on the location from which they are travelling.", "", "
SA Premier Steven Marshall says there are no plans to introduce a cost for PCR tests for those without symptoms.
", "
No cost for PCR tests in SA\u00a0
", "In Queensland, PCR tests are free for people with\u00a0COVID-19 symptoms but those without symptoms will be charged\u00a0about $150 at a private pathology clinic.\u00a0", "When Queensland opens its border new arrivals must show a negative PCR test to gain entry.\u00a0", "During a press conference earlier today, Mr Marshall was questioned whether PCR tests for COVID-19 would remain free of charge in SA.\u00a0", "\"The reality is we want people to get checked in South Australia, I want to make sure we can maintain the great record we've had in terms of\u00a0keeping the coronavirus at bay.", "\"We don't see that it's logical for our state to introduce a charge for the pathology services for that PCR test.\"\u00a0", "The opening hours at COVID-19 sites across the state will be extended from tomorrow.\u00a0", "The cap of 20 people at home gatherings will also be increased to 30 people.\u00a0", "Also from tomorrow, the requirement for overseas travellers coming into the state\u00a0to quarantine for 14 days will be reduced to seven days.", "", "
Going overseas? Here's what you need to know
"]
